column4: I like python's mix of functional + OO programming options. I thought their stuff to be very readable. I read http://diveintopython.org.
I got hooked by ESR's article in LJ. Python is now my hammer of choice (everything looks like a nail). Clean syntax and OO features you can ignore if you want to.
I have played with cx_Oracle to talk to Oracle database servers, and omniORB for CORBA. Unfortunately, our app servers' IDL files weren't CORBA compliant. :(
I couldn't write a python gateway to replace the java gateway we currently have.
